definition: iAsk.com, the search engine of Sina 新浪
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Love asked knowledge, another old woman, "Who helped me?"
sentences.chinese: 爱问知识是谁帮助了我。

sentences.english: That's why. You're always asking me questions.
sentences.chinese: 那是因为你老爱问我一些不着边的问题。

definition: to go to the bottom of things (idiom)
pinyin: da3 po4 sha1 guo1 wen4 dao4 di3

definition: lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to dig up roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
quotation (from a book or existing source)
lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to get to the heart of the matter
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
